Answer.ind_fachoused: The Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA) was passed in 2003 with unanimous support from both parties in Congress. The purpose of the act was to “provide for the analysis of the incidence and effects of prison rape in Federal, State, and local institutions and to provide information, resources, recommendations and funding to protect individuals from prison rape.” This law applies to all public and private institutions that house adult or juvenile offenders

Answer.ind_county_commit: There are a number of potential explanations for the variance in recidivism percentages. Many are policy decisions, such as types of individuals sentenced to prison, how offenders are selected for release, the length of stay under supervision, and decisions about how to respond to violations of supervision.  RECIDIVISM Iowa Prison Recidivism Recidivism is the act of an individual leaving prison who is then reincarcerated within three years for any reason.    Learn about Iowa Prison Recidivism

Answer.ind_county_commit: Medical staff responded quickly and provided first aid to Aguilera, Cuen, and Nanez. Aguilera was transported to a local hospital for further treatment. He is still hospitalized in serious condition.
Answer.ind_custody: Medical staff responded quickly and provided first aid to Aguilera, Cuen, and Nanez. Aguilera was transported to a local hospital for further treatment. He is still hospitalized in serious condition.
Answer.ind_fachoused: , Frank Nanez and Raul Cuen, attacked Anthony Aguilera with inmate manufactured weapons. Staff quickly responded, first issuing verbal orders to stop and get down, which were ignored. A warning shot from a Mini-14 rifle was fired, which had no effect. Staff then fired additional rounds when the attack continued. Chemical agents were also deployed. Both Nanez and Cuen sustained gunshot wounds. No other incarcerated people or staff members were injured.

Answer.ind_county_commit: Wildlife troopers in Alaska enforce all laws. In addition to the missions of the Alaska Wildlife Troopers, we respond to search and rescues, investigate major crimes, including homicides, and enforce traffic laws. Answer.ind_county_commit: FDC has a constitutional mandate to provide health care for all inmates incarcerated in Florida’s prisons. This includes preventative health services, dental, mental health treatment, hospital care, and treatment of chronic disease. The Department is committed to ensuring inmates receive appropriate medical and behavioral health care that is in line with evolving standards of care nationally.

Answer.ind_county_commit: An inmate at the Pine Bluff Unit is suspected of taking his life last night. Richard Ressler apparently used a cord to hang himself in the barracks shower. After being alerted by another inmate at 8:20 p.m., staff immediately began lifesaving measures, and an ambulance was called. The efforts were continued by emergency medical personnel. Ressler was pronounced dead at 9:09 p.m. in the emergency room at Jefferson Regional Medical Center. Ressler was serving a 30-year sentence for rape. He was convicted February 18, 2016, in Craighead County.
Answer.ind_custody: An inmate at the Pine Bluff Unit is suspected of taking his life last night. Richard Ressler apparently used a cord to hang himself in the barracks shower. After being alerted by another inmate at 8:20 p.m., staff immediately began lifesaving measures, and an ambulance was called. The efforts were continued by emergency medical personnel. Ressler was pronounced dead at 9:09 p.m. in the emergency room at Jefferson Regional Medical Center. Ressler was serving a 30-year sentence for rape. He was convicted February 18, 2016, in Craighead County.
Answer.ind_fachoused: Matthew A. Ferry-Payne, an inmate at the Varner Super Max, was pronounced dead at 3:05 a.m. today in the unit’s infirmary after apparently taking his own life. During a security round, a correctional sergeant heard an inmate shouting for help. When the officer reached that cell, inmate Ferry-Payne, 30, was on the floor of the cell. His cellmate reported awakening to find Ferry-Payne hanging by a bed sheet and then pulling him to the ground in an effort to save his life. Attempts by medical personnel to revive Inmate Ferry-Payne failed. He was serving a 10-year sentence out of Benton County for two counts of second degree battery, two counts of firearm possession by certain persons, and terroristic threatening.
Answer.ind_first_name: Providing Safety and Hope for Arkansans

NKSP opened in April 1993, and is a medium security prison as well as a Reception Center (RC) housing approximately 3,500 inmates. Asystole due to chronic health conditions

The D.C. Department of Corrections (DOC) is committed to providing a safe and secure environment for those in our custody and care. On Monday, September 25, 2023, DOC security personnel intervened when resident Larry Watson (41), of Washington DC, became suddenly ill at the Central Detention Facility.  DOC medical personnel performed live-saving measures on site. Fire and Emergency Management Services responded to the scene and transported Mr. Watson to Washington Hospital Center, where he later died on Tuesday, September 26.  The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner will be conducting an autopsy to determine cause and manner of death. Mr. Watson’s next of kin have been notified. Our condolences are with Mr. Watson’s family during this difficult time.

Eric Tice, superintendent of the State Correctional Institution at Somerset, reported that inmate Ryan Lynn Horton, 34, was found unresponsive in his cell on April 11, 2023. Prison staff and medical personnel immediately responded and provided life-saving measures.  EMS arrived and advanced life support measures were continued. He was declared deceased at 6:16 PM.
